It's funny because 75 years ago Americans had a reputation for being honest and plainspoken, while Brits were thought to be mealy-mouthed and obsessed with propriety, says Toby Young . ''It's as if we've switched places.'' But with Simon Cowell gone, who's going to judge our nation of underachievers? AEvangelista at 12:06 AM January 19, 2011
